docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 12 -- Exports to British Empire countries in January increased 12 per cent over those in December, but the gain was offset almost entirely by declines in shipments to Japan and Latin America, the Department of Commerce announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 12 -- Exports to British Empire countries in January increased 12 per cent over those in December, but the gain was offset almost entirely by declines in shipments to Japan and Latin America, the Department of Commerce announced today.
docs.abstract: U S Commerce Dept rept on U S trade, Jan

headline.main: BUYING BY BRITISH ROSE IN JANUARY; 12% Upturn Offset Decline in Latin-American and Japanese Trade Here PLANES GO TO GOLD COAST Malaya and Union of South Africa Also Get Aircraft From This Country BUYING BY BRITISH ROSE IN JANUARY

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., March 15 -- Following the current emphasis on Pan-Americanism, the Smith Alumnae College, held each year to enable alumnae to obtain an academic approach to current problems and which will occur this year June 17-21, will have as...
docs.lead_paragraph: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., March 15 -- Following the current emphasis on Pan-Americanism, the Smith Alumnae College, held each year to enable alumnae to obtain an academic approach to current problems and which will occur this year June 17-21, will have as its subject "The Americas -- 1941," according to announcement made by Miss Dorothy Fosdick, chairman of the education committee of the Smith College Alumnae Association.

headline.main: Alumnae to Study 'Americas of 1941'; Smith College Plans Annual Refresher Course on Current Problems

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LUIS QUINTANILLA, Minister Plenipotentiary and counselor of the Mexican Embassy at Washington, will be the principal speaker at the International Flower Show Committee dinner at the Waldorf-Astoria on Tuesday. Because the show's theme is Pan-America,...
docs.lead_paragraph: LUIS QUINTANILLA, Minister Plenipotentiary and counselor of the Mexican Embassy at Washington, will be the principal speaker at the International Flower Show Committee dinner at the Waldorf-Astoria on Tuesday. Because the show's theme is Pan-America, the dinner's will be also.

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market last week was quiet. Turnover was small and price changes narrow. The one distinguishing mark was that of the executive proclamation freezing the balances and assets of Hungary and her nationals, an order similar to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market last week was quiet. Turnover was small and price changes narrow. The one distinguishing mark was that of the executive proclamation freezing the balances and assets of Hungary and her nationals, an order similar to the ban placed against other countries in the war area. Trading in the pengo has always been light and its current price of 19.85 cents one which had been carried forward from last November without change.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 15, 1941

docs.snippet: MIAMI, Fla., March 16 -- Fear that an acute shortage of shipping may hamper American industry's efforts to increase its raw materials purchases in Central and South America was expressed here tonight by members of the National Research Council, who...
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, Fla., March 16 -- Fear that an acute shortage of shipping may hamper American industry's efforts to increase its raw materials purchases in Central and South America was expressed here tonight by members of the National Research Council, who depart by Clipper tomorrow for a tour of major Latin-American nations.

headline.main: SHORTAGE FEARED IN LATIN SHIPPING; Survey Group of Research Council to Study Problem on South American Tour 21 LEAVE BY PLANE TODAY Substantial Increase in Goods Exchanged With Nations Is Held Vital to Hemisphere

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 18 -- Uruguay is in the midst of a government crisis that is expected to lead to revision of the constitution. President Alfredo Baldomir is determined to end collaboration of the Nationalist party in the Cabinet because it...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 18 -- Uruguay is in the midst of a government crisis that is expected to lead to revision of the constitution. President Alfredo Baldomir is determined to end collaboration of the Nationalist party in the Cabinet because it has continued stubbornly to deadlock all government measures in Congress.

headline.main: GOVERNMENT CRISIS FORCED IN URUGUAY; President Ousts Three of His Cabinet in Move Toward Change in Constitution FIGHTS MINORITY CONTROL Group Led by Axis Supporter Blocks Baldomir Defense Program in Congress

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITEWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 19 -- President Alfredo Baldomir today accepted the resignations of three Nationalist party Cabinet members and turned their departments over to three of the five remaining Cabinet members.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 19 -- President Alfredo Baldomir today accepted the resignations of three Nationalist party Cabinet members and turned their departments over to three of the five remaining Cabinet members.
docs.abstract: Baldomir transfers depts of ousted Mins to 3 of 5 remaining Mins; 5 listed

headline.main: URUGUAYAN CABINET DROPS NATIONALISTS; Party With Half Senate Seats Is Likely to Become Opposition
